body:
It would appear that dataclasses now do not work since https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/3dc2b9dfc23638fbef2558d619709b5235d5df08 was implemented.

Using the most recent master commit at the time of writing:
```py
# test.py
import dataclasses

@dataclasses.dataclass()
class Foo:
    bar: str = dataclasses.field(default="hello")

print(Foo("hi"))
print(Foo())
```
```bash
>>> cythonize test.py -3i

gcc -pthread -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O3 -Wall -march=x86-64 -mtune=generic -O3 -pipe -fno-plt -march=x86-64 -mtune=generic -O3 -pipe -fno-plt -march=x86-64 -mtune=generic -O3 -pipe -fno-plt -fPIC -I/home/.../code/hikari/.venv/include -I/usr/include/python3.8 -c /home/.../code/cython-bug/test.c -o /home/.../code/cython-bug/tmpbh4j4lqe/home/.../code/cython-bug/test.o
gcc -pthread -shared -Wl,-O1,--sort-common,--as-needed,-z,relro,-z,now -Wl,-O1,--sort-common,--as-needed,-z,relro,-z,now /home/.../code/cython-bug/tmpbh4j4lqe/home/.../code/cython-bug/test.o -L/usr/lib -o /home/.../code/cython-bug/test.cpython-38-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
```

comment_data.body: Isn't this just #2552? Did this ever work for you before? What does `Foo.__annotations__` give?

title: Dataclasses do not work with Cython due to annotations being stripped out.
